page.title: 08 Harpole Water Tower
page.content:
Anglian Water Board own the 1 1/2 acre site on which the 60 feet high water tower stands. It is made of reinforced concrete & is 35 years old.
The water travels from Pitsford Reservoir, where it has been filtered & chlorinated, in a 700 mm pipe. Close to the water tower some water is diverted from this main pipe into a 400 mm pipe which fills the water tower. The pure water is stored for normally 24 hours & is then used to supply Harpole and some of Duston. The tower stores 250,000 gallons of water.
The area surrounding the water tower is made secure by high fencing. Inside, on ground floor level, it is used for storage.
